Basic Example

Must have at least six characters.

Not a valid code.

Example block-level help text here.

Bootstrap docs 
<form role="form">
  <div class="form-group form-group-required">
    <label class="control-label" for="exampleInputEmail1">Email address</label>
    <input type="email" class="form-control" id="exampleInputEmail1" placeholder="Enter email">
  </div>
  <div class="form-group form-group-required">
    <label class="control-label" for="exampleInputPassword1">Password</label>
    <input type="password" class="form-control" id="exampleInputPassword1" placeholder="Password">
    <p class="help-block is-error-msg">Must have at least six characters.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="form-group">
    <input class="form-control" id="disabledInput" type="text" placeholder="Disabled input here..." disabled>
  </div>
  <div class="form-group form-group-required has-error">
    <label class="control-label" for="inputError1">Input with error</label>
    <input type="text" class="form-control" id="inputError1">
    <p class="help-block is-error-msg">Not a valid code.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="form-group">
    <label class="control-label"  for="exampleInputFile">File input, not required</label>
    <input type="file" id="exampleInputFile">
    <p class="help-block">Example block-level help text here.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="checkbox">
    <label>
      <input type="checkbox"> Check me out
    </label>
  </div>
  <div class="radio">
    <label>
      <input type="radio"> I am radio button
    </label>
  </div>
  <button type="submit" class="btn btn-primary btn-rounded btn-shaded">Submit</button>
</form>

Password

Example of password field using hide-show-password functionality via hideShowPassword (jQuery plugin).

<div class="form-group form-group-required">
  <label class="control-label" for="exampleInputPassword1">Password</label>
  <input class="form-control" data-password id="signupPassword" type="password" placeholder="Password" />
</div>

<script>
$(function() {
  $('[data-password]').showPassword('focus');
});
</script>

Select

Bootstrap docs 
<div class="form-group">
  <select class="form-control">
    <option>1</option>
    <option>2</option>
    <option>3</option>
    <option>4</option>
    <option>5</option>
  </select>
</div>

Custom Select In progress

Allow a custom element to behave as if a native <select> would. Initial value and value updates will apply to the .js-select-value element therein. You can "delegate" focus states to an inner element with the .js-select-delegate class.

<div class="select">
  <select>
    <option selected>John Lennon</option>
    <option>Paul McCartney</option>
    <option>George Harrison</option>
    <option>Ringo Starr</option>
  </select>
  <span class="btn btn-block btn-default js-select-delegate" aria-hidden="true">
    <span class="js-select-value"></span>
    <span class="arrow-down"></span>
  </span>
</div>

<script>

$(function(){

  $('.select').each(function(){
    // Save some elements as variables
    var $element = $(this);
    var $select = $element.find('select');
    var $value = $element.find('.js-select-value');

    // Allow for a delegate for state classes (useful for avoiding duplication
    // in button styles, etc.)
    var $delegate = $element.find('.js-select-delegate');
    if (!$delegate.length) $delegate = $element;

    // Bind event handlers to <select>
    $select.on({
      // On change or keyup, update the value text
      'change keyup': function () {
        $value.text($select.find('option:selected').text());
      },
      // Focus/blur
      'focus blur': function (event) {
        $delegate.toggleClass('focus', event.type === 'focus');
      }
    });
    // Trigger the change event so the value is current
    $select.trigger('change');
  });

});

</script>

Phone (tel) Field

Basic usage of the intl-tel-input jQuery (vendor) plugin.

<div class="form-group form-group-required">
    <label class="control-label" for="signupPhone">Phone number</label>
    <input type="tel" class="form-control" id="signupPhone" data-mask-type="tel" data-country-select="#signupCountry"/>
  </div>

<script>
$(function() {
  $('[data-mask-type="tel"]').intlTelInput();
});
</script>
